CSSOMì˜ ê²½ìš°ì—ëŠ” ìŠ¤í¬ë¦°ì— ë³´ì—¬ì§€ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” <meta>, <script> , <title> ê°™ì€ ë” ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ ì†ì„±ì„ í¬í•¨í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ”ë‹¤.

CSSëŠ” html íƒœê·¸ì˜ style ì†ì„±ì— ë„£ëŠ” ì¸ë¼ì¸ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ë§, ì„ë² ë””ë“œ, ìœ ì € ì—ì´ì „íŠ¸ ë“± ë‹¤ì–‘í•œ ê²½ë¡œì—ì„œ ì†ŒìŠ¤ê°€ ì œê³µëœë‹¤. ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €ëŠ” ëª¨ë“  ê²½ë¡œì˜ ì†ŒìŠ¤ë¥¼ ì•„ìš°ë¥¸ ìµœì¢… CSS í”„ë¡œí¼í‹°ë¥¼ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ì—¬ ë…¸ë“œë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•œë‹¤. CSSê°€ íŠ¸ë¦¬ êµ¬ì¡°ë¥¼ ê°€ì§„ ì†ì„±ì´ë¼ëŠ” ê²ƒì€ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ë§ ì†ì„±ì´ ìƒë‹¨ì— ìœ„ì¹˜í•œ íƒœê·¸ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ë§ì„ ìƒì†í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì—ì„œë„ ì•Œì•„ë³¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤. font-size ê°™ì€ ì†ì„±ì´ ìƒìœ„ <div> íƒœê·¸ì— ì ìš©ë˜ì–´ìˆìœ¼ë©´ ê·¸ ì•ˆì— ìœ„ì¹˜í•˜ëŠ” <span> íƒœê·¸ì—ì„œë„ ë™ì¼í•œ font-size ë¥¼ ìƒì†í•œë‹¤(inherit).

Render Tree

ë Œë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ëŠ” ë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ì™€ CSSOM íŠ¸ë¦¬ê°€ í•©ì³ì§„ íŠ¸ë¦¬ êµ¬ì¡°ì´ë‹¤. ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €ëŠ” í™”ë©´ì— ë³´ì´ëŠ” ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ë“¤ì˜ ë ˆì´ì•„ì›ƒê³¼ ìŠ¤í¬ë¦°ì— ì´ë¥¼ ê·¸ë¦¬ê¸°(í˜ì¸íŠ¸) ìœ„í•œ ê³„ì‚°ì„ í•´ì•¼ í•˜ëŠ”ë°, ì´ë¥¼ ìœ„í•´ ë Œë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•œë‹¤. ì¦‰ DOM Treeì™€ CSSOM ê³„ì‚°ì€ ë Œë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ë¥¼ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•œ ì„ í–‰ ê³¼ì •ì´ë©° ë Œë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ê°€ í˜•ì„±ë˜ì–´ì•¼ë§Œ ìš°ë¦¬ê°€ ì›í•˜ëŠ” í™”ë©´ì„ ìŠ¤í¬ë¦°ì— ë ìš¸ ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤. ë˜í•œ ìŠ¤í¬ë¦°ì— ë…¸ì¶œë˜ëŠ” í˜•íƒœë§Œ ë‹´ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— í”½ì…€ì„ ì°¨ì§€í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ì˜ì—­ì˜ ë…¸ë“œëŠ” í¬í•¨í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ”ë‹¤. ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ display:none; ì†ì„±ì„ ê°€ì§„ ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ëŠ” ë Œë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ì— í¬í•¨ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ”ë‹¤.

DOM íŠ¸ë¦¬ì™€ CSSOM íŠ¸ë¦¬ë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•˜ê³ , ë Œë”ë§ ë¡œì§ì„ í•¸ë“¤ë§í•˜ëŠ” ì¼ë ¨ì˜ ê³¼ì •ë“¤ì€ Browser Engine(ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì € ì—”ì§„, ë Œë”ë§ ì—”ì§„ í˜¹ì€ ë ˆì´ì•„ì›ƒ ì—”ì§„ì´ë¼ê³ ë„ ë¶ˆë¦¼)ì´ë¼ëŠ” ì†Œí”„íŠ¸ì›¨ì–´ë¥¼ í†µí•´ ì´ë¤„ì§„ë‹¤. ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì € ì—”ì§„ì€ HTML ì½”ë“œë¡œë¶€í„° ì›¹ í˜ì´ì§€ë¥¼ ë Œë”ë§ í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•œ í•„ìˆ˜ ìš”ì†Œë“¤ê³¼ ë¡œì§ì„ ì§€ë‹ˆê³  ìˆë‹¤.

Webkitì´ë¼ëŠ” ë‹¨ì–´ì— ëŒ€í•´ ì•„ë§ˆ ì•Œê³ ë“¤ ìˆì„ ê²ƒì´ë‹¤. Webkitì€ ì‚¬íŒŒë¦¬ ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €ê°€ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ê³  ìˆê³  êµ¬ê¸€ í¬ë¡¬ ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €ì˜ ë””í´íŠ¸ ë Œë”ë§ ì—”ì§„ì´ì—ˆë‹¤. (í˜„ì¬ í¬ë¡¬ì€ Blinkì—”ì§„ì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ê³  ìˆìŒ) ì—¬ê¸°ë¥¼ ëˆ„ë¥´ë©´ í˜„ì¬ ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €ë“¤ì´ ì‚¬ìš©ì¤‘ì¸ ì—”ì§„ì„ í™•ì¸í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.

ìš”ì•½í•˜ë©´,

ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €ê°€ HTML í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ì½ê³  ë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ë¥¼ í˜•ì„±í•œë‹¤ â†’ ëª¨ë“  ì†ŒìŠ¤ì—ì„œ ê°€ì ¸ì˜¨ CSSë¥¼ ì½ì–´ì„œ CSSOM íŠ¸ë¦¬ë¥¼ í˜•ì„±í•œë‹¤ â†’ ë” íŠ¸ë¦¬ì™€ CSSOM íŠ¸ë¦¬ë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ê³  Render-Treeë¥¼ í˜•ì„±í•œë‹¤ â†’ Render-Treeë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ê³  ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ë¥¼ ìŠ¤í¬ë¦°ì— ê·¸ë¦°ë‹¤.

ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ íŒŒì¼ì„ bodyíƒœê·¸ì˜ í•˜ë‹¨ì— ìœ„ì¹˜ì‹œì¼œì•¼ í•˜ëŠ” ì´ìœ 

DOMì´ íŒŒì‹± ì‘ì—…ì„ í•˜ë‹¤ê°€ ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ íŒŒì¼ì„ ë§Œë‚˜ë©´ íŒŒì‹±ì„ ì¤‘ë‹¨ì‹œí‚¤ê³  ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ë¥¼ ì‹¤í–‰í•œë‹¤. DOM íŒŒì‹± ì‘ì—…ì€ ë³´í†µ ë©”ì¸ ìŠ¤ë ˆë“œì—ì„œ ì´ë¤„ì§€ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— ë§Œì•½ ë©”ì¸ ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ ìŠ¤ë ˆë“œê°€ ì—¬ìœ ê°€ ì—†ìœ¼ë©´ DOM íŒŒì‹± ì‘ì—…ì€ í•´ë‹¹ ìŠ¤ë ˆë“œì— ì—¬ìœ ê°€ ìƒê¸¸ë•Œê¹Œì§€ ì—°ê¸°ëœë‹¤. ì´ ë§ì€ ì¦‰, script ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ëŠ” parser-blocking(íŒŒì„œ ì°¨ë‹¨)ì„ í•œë‹¤ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ë‹¤. ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €ëŠ” DOM APIë¥¼ ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ ëŸ°íƒ€ì„ì— ë…¸ì¶œì‹œí‚¤ëŠ”ë°, ì¦‰ ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ íŒŒì¼ì—ì„œ DOM ìš”ì†Œë¥¼ ì¡°ì‘í•˜ê³  ì ‘ê·¼í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤ëŠ” ëœ»ì´ë‹¤. ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ script ì‹¤í–‰ê³¼ ë” íŒŒì‹±ì´ í‰í–‰ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¼ì–´ë‚˜ê²Œ ë˜ë©´ race condition ì¡°ê±´(Race Conditionì— ëŒ€í•œ ì„¤ëª…ì€ ì—¬ê¸°)ì— ë´‰ì°©í•˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— ë” íŒŒì‹± ë‹¨ê³„ê°€ ë©”ì¸ ìŠ¤ë ˆë“œì—ì„œ ì¼ì–´ë‚˜ì•¼ í•œë‹¤.

What is Big O?

Big-O í‘œê¸°ë²•ì€ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì˜ ë³µì¡ë„ë¥¼ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ëŠ” í‘œê¸°ë²•ì´ë‹¤. ë˜í•œ ì†”ë£¨ì…˜ ì¤‘ ì–´ë–¤ ê²ƒì´ ë” ì í•©í•œì§€ë¥¼ ê°€ë¥´ê¸° ìœ„í•œ ì ‘ê·¼ ë°©ë²•ì´ë‹¤. ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ â€˜ì í•©í•˜ë‹¤â€™ë¼ëŠ” ê²ƒì˜ ê¸°ì¤€ì€ í”„ë¡œê·¸ë¨ì´ ì†Œìš”ë˜ëŠ” ì‹œê°„ê³¼ ë©”ëª¨ë¦¬ë¥¼ ì°¨ì§€í•˜ëŠ” ê³µê°„ ë¦¬ì†ŒìŠ¤ë¥¼ ì–¼ë§ˆë‚˜ ì ê²Œ ì°¨ì§€í•˜ëƒëŠ” ê²ƒì´ë‹¤.

ì™œ Big Oë¥¼ ì“¸ê¹Œ?

ê°™ì€ í”„ë¡œê·¸ë¨ê³¼ ê°™ì€ inputì´ ì£¼ì–´ì§„ë‹¤ê³  í•˜ë”ë¼ë„ êµ¬ë™ë˜ëŠ” ì»´í“¨í„°ì˜ ìŠ¤í™ì´ë‚˜ ë°±ê·¸ë¼ìš´ë“œì—ì„œ ì‘ë™ì¤‘ì¸ ê¸°íƒ€ ì‘ì—…ë“¤ì— ì˜í•´ í”„ë¡œê·¸ë¨ì˜ ìˆ˜í–‰ ì‹œê°„ì€ ë‹¬ë¼ì§ˆ ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤. Big O í‘œê¸°ë²•ì€ ì´ëŸ° ë°°ê²½ì ì¸ ë³€ìˆ˜ìš”ì¸ì„ ë‚ ë ¤ë²„ë¦¬ê³  ì‹œê°„ì , ê³µê°„ì  í•„ìš”ìš”ì†Œì— ì§‘ì¤‘í•œë‹¤. Big OëŠ” worst case ì‹œë‚˜ë¦¬ì˜¤ì— ëŒ€ë¹„í•˜ê¸°ì— ì ì ˆí•œ ë°©ë²•ì´ë‹¤.

const getAverage = (numbers) => {
  let sum = 0;
  
  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {
    let number = numbers[i];
    sum += number;
  }
  
  return sum / numbers.length;
}

console.log(getAverage([12, 1, 50, 24]));

ì¤„ 4ì˜ i < numbers.length , i++ , ì¤„ 5, 6ì˜ let number = numbers[i] , sum += number ì—ì„œ ì—°ì‚° ê³¼ì •ì´ ì¶”ê°€ë˜ë¯€ë¡œ O(4n)ì´ë¼ê³  ìƒê°í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆì§€ë§Œ, ë¹… ì˜¤ëŠ” ì¸í’‹ì˜ í¬ê¸°ì—ë§Œ ì§‘ì¤‘í•˜ë¯€ë¡œ O(4n)ì´ ì•„ë‹Œ O(n)ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œê¸°í•œë‹¤. (ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ nì€ ì–´ë ˆì´ ì¸í’‹ì˜ ê¸¸ì´ì´ë‹¤)

ì¸í’‹ì˜ í¬ê¸°ê°€ ë‹¬ë¼ì§ì— ë”°ë¼ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì˜ ì„±ëŠ¥ì— ì–´ë–¤ ë³€í™”ê°€ ìˆëŠ”ì§€ì— ì§‘ì¤‘í•œë‹¤.

Product Rule(ê³„ìˆ˜ë²•ì¹™)

n ê°’ì— ì–´ë– í•œ ìƒìˆ˜ê°€ ê³±í•´ì§€ë”ë¼ë„ ì´ëŠ” ì˜ë¯¸ë¥¼ ê°–ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ”ë‹¤. ì…ë ¥ì˜ í¬ê¸°ê°€ ë¬´í•œì— ê°€ê¹Œì›Œì§€ëŠ” ê²½ìš° ìƒìˆ˜ëŠ” ë³„ ì˜í–¥ì„ ë¼ì¹˜ì§€ ì•Šê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì´ë‹¤.

  • O(4 * n) â‡’ O(n)
  • O(252n) â‡’ O(n)
  • O(n / 5) â‡’ O(n)
  • O(4 * n * n) â‡’ O(n2)
  • O(412) â‡’ O(1)

Sum Rule(í•©ì˜ ë²•ì¹™)

ì—°ì‚°ì´ ì—¬ëŸ¬ í•­ì´ ì¡´ì¬í•œë‹¤ë©´ ê·¸ ì¤‘ì— ê°€ì¥ í° í•­ë§Œ ë‚¨ê¸°ê³  ë‚˜ë¨¸ì§€ëŠ” ë¬´ì‹œí•œë‹¤.

  • O(n + 1000) â‡’ O(n)
  • O(n2 + n) â‡’ O(n2)
  • O(n + 500 + n3 + n2) â‡’ O(n3)

Product Rule + Sum Rule

Sum Ruleì„ ì ìš©í•˜ê³  Product Ruleì„ ì ìš©í•˜ì.

  • O(5n2 + 100n + 17) â‡’ O(n2)
  • O((n/3)6 + 10n) â‡’ O(n6)

ì‹œê°„ ë³µì¡ë„ ì˜ˆì œ

const foo = (n) => {
  for (let i = 0; i < n.length; i++) {
    console.log(i)
  }
  
  for (let j = 0; j < 11; j++) {
    for (let k = 0; k < n; k++) {
      console.log('j ', n, ' k');
    }
  }
}

O(n + 11n) â‡’ O(n)

ê³µê°„ ë³µì¡ë„ ì˜ˆì œ 1

const getAverage = (numbers) => {
  let sum = 0;
  
  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {
    let number = numbers[i];
    sum += number;
  }
  
  return sum / numbers.length;
}

ì–¼ë§ˆë‚˜ ê³µê°„ì„ ì°¨ì§€í•˜ëŠ”ì§€ë¥¼ íŒë‹¨í•œë‹¤. ë³€ìˆ˜ ì§€ì •ì€ ë©”ëª¨ë¦¬ ê³µê°„ì„ ì†Œìš”í•˜ë¯€ë¡œ ìœ„ í•¨ìˆ˜ì—ì„œ ë³€ìˆ˜ë¡œ ì§€ì •ë˜ì–´ìˆëŠ” sum , number , i ì´ 3ê°œ, ì¦‰ O(3) â‡’ O(1)ê°€ ê³µê°„ë³µì¡ë„ê°€ ëœë‹¤. (number ì˜ ê²½ìš° ë°˜ë³µë ë•Œë§ˆë‹¤ ë³€ìˆ˜ ë©”ëª¨ë¦¬ê°€ ìƒì„±ë˜ê³  ì‚¬ë¼ì§€ê³ ë¥¼ ë°˜ë³µí•˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— ìƒìˆ˜ì´ë‹¤). inputìœ¼ë¡œ ì£¼ì–´ì§€ëŠ” ë³€ìˆ˜ì˜ ê°¯ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ê³ ë ¤í•˜ì§€ ì•Šê³  í•¨ìˆ˜ê°€ ì‹¤í–‰ë¨ì— ë”°ë¼ í•„ìš”ë¡œí•˜ëŠ” ë©”ëª¨ë¦¬ë¥¼ ê³ ë ¤í•´ì•¼í•œë‹¤.

ê³µê°„ ë³µì¡ë„ ì˜ˆì œ 2

const doubler = (items) => {
  let newArr = [];
  
  for (let i = 0; i < items.length; i++) {
    newArr.push(items[i])
    newArr.push(items[i])
  }
  return newArr;
}

for loopì„ ëŒ ë•Œë§ˆë‹¤ itemì´ ë‘ë²ˆ ì¶”ê°€ëœë‹¤. ì¦‰, nê°œì˜ ì–´ë ˆì´ê°€ ìˆë‹¤ë©´ ë‘ë²ˆì”© ì¶”ê°€ë˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— 2n, O(2n)ì´ ë˜ê³  ì´ëŠ” ê³„ìˆ˜ë²•ì¹™ì— ë”°ë¼ O(n)ì´ ëœë‹¤.

ì¬ê·€ ì½”ë“œ ë¶„ì„

ì‹œê°„, ê³µê°„ ë³µì¡ë„ì™€ ì¬ê·€ ì½”ë“œ

const zoom = (n) => {
  if (n === 0) {
    return console.log(0)
  }
  
  console.log(n)
  zoom(n - 1);
}

zoom(10)

ì‹œê°„ ë³µì¡ë„: O(n), ì£¼ì–´ì§€ëŠ” në§Œí¼ ì¬ê·€ í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ í˜¸ì¶œí•˜ê²Œ ëœë‹¤.

ê³µê°„ ë³µì¡ë„: O(n), í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ í˜¸ì¶œí•˜ëŠ” ë°ì— në§Œí¼ì˜ ìŠ¤íƒì´ ì†Œìš”ëœë‹¤.

const zap = n => {
  if (n < 1) {
    console.log("blastoff!")
    return
  }
  console.log(n)
  zap(n - 2)
}

zap(10);

ì‹œê°„ ë³µì¡ë„: O(n/2) â‡’ O(n)

ê³µê°„ ë³µì¡ë„: O(n/2) â‡’ O(n)

ì´ 7ë‹¨ê³„ì˜ ë¹…ì˜¤ í‘œê¸°ë²•ì„ íš¨ìœ¨ì ì¸ ìˆœìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚˜ì—´í•´ë³´ì.


1) O(1)

const constant = (n) => {
  for (let i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
    console.log(`${n} + 5 = ${n + 5}`)
  }
}

ì–´ë–¤ í¬ê¸°ì˜ ì¸í’‹ì´ë“  for loopì€ 5ë²ˆì— êµ­í•œëœë‹¤. O(5) ì´ë¯€ë¡œ O(1)ì´ë¼ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.

2) O(logN)

ë¡œê·¸ëŠ” ê¸°í•˜ ì—°ì‚°ì˜ ë°˜ëŒ€ë¡œ ê¸°í•˜ì—°ì‚°ì´ ë°˜ë³µëœ ê³±ì…ˆì´ë¼ë©´ ë¡œê·¸ëŠ” ë°˜ë³µëœ ë‚˜ëˆ—ì…ˆì´ë‹¤. log2(32) â‡’ 2ë¥¼ ëª‡ ë²ˆ(x) ê³±í–ˆì„ ë•Œ 32ê°€ ë‚˜ì˜¤ëŠ”ê°€? 5ë²ˆì´ë¯€ë¡œ log2(32)ì˜ ê°’ì€ 5ì´ë‹¤. log3(9) â‡’ 3ì„ 2ë²ˆ ê³±í–ˆì„ ë•Œ 9ê°€ ë‚˜ì˜¤ë¯€ë¡œ ê°’ì€ 2ì´ë‹¤. ë¹… ì˜¤ í‘œê¸°ë²•ì—ì„œ ì“°ì´ëŠ” logëŠ” ë°‘ì´ ìƒëµë˜ì–´ìˆëŠ”ë°, ì´ëŠ” ë¹…ì˜¤ í‘œê¸°ë²•ì—ì„œëŠ” ë°‘ì„ 2ë¡œ ê°„ì£¼í•˜ê³  ìƒëµí•˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì´ë‹¤. 

const logExample = (n) => {
  while (n > 1) {
    console.log(n);
    n /= 2;
  }
}

// 12
// 6
// 3
// 1.5
// 'done'
// ê°™ì€ í•¨ìˆ˜ì´ì§€ë§Œ ì¬ê·€ë¡œ ë°”ê¿ˆ
const logExample = (n) => {
  while (n < 1) {
    console.log("done");
    return;
  }
  console.log(n)
  logExample(n / 2)
}

3) O(n)

const linear = (arr) => {
  for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
    console.log(arr[i] * arr[i])
  }
}

ì¸í’‹ê°’ì´ ì¦ê°€í•¨ì— ë”°ë¼ ì„ í˜•ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ ë‹¨ê³„ê°€ ì¦ê°€í•œë‹¤. ì›ì†Œ í•˜ë‚˜ê°€ ì¶”ê°€ë˜ë©´ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ ë‹¨ê³„ë„ í•˜ë‚˜ì”© ëŠ˜ì–´ë‚œë‹¤.

4) O(n*log(N)): ì„ í˜•ë¡œê·¸

const bar = (str) => {
  console.log(str);
  if (str.length <= 1) return;
  const midIdx = Math.floor(str.length / 2);
  bar(str.slice(0, midIdx));

item.content:encoded:
Iterableì€ ES6ì˜ ë“±ì¥ê³¼ í•¨ê»˜ ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ì˜ ì–´ë–¤ ì½œë ‰ì…˜ë„ for..of loopë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì—¬ ë°˜ë³µ ê°€ëŠ¥í•œ ê°ì²´ë¡œ ë§Œë“¤ì–´ì£¼ëŠ” ìœ ìš©í•œ ê¸°ëŠ¥ì´ë‹¤.

ê°ì²´ì˜ Symbol.iterator í‚¤ê°’ì— íŠ¹ì • í˜•íƒœì˜ í•¨ìˆ˜ê°€ ë“¤ì–´ìˆë‹¤ë©´, ì´ë¥¼ ë°˜ë³µ ê°€ëŠ¥í•œ ê°ì²´(iterable object) í˜¹ì€ ì¤„ì—¬ì„œ iterableì´ë¼ ë¶€ë¥´ê³ , í•´ë‹¹ ê°ì²´ëŠ” iterable protocolì„ ë§Œì¡±í•œë‹¤ê³  ë§í•œë‹¤.

ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ì—ì„œ built-inìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚´ì¥ iterable íŠ¹ì§•ì„ ê°–ê³  ìˆëŠ” ìë£Œêµ¬ì¡°ë“¤ì€ ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ë‹¤.

  • String

ì–´ë–¤ ê°ì²´ê°€ Iterableì´ë¼ë©´, ê·¸ ê°ì²´ì— ëŒ€í•´ì„œ ì•„ë˜ì˜ ê¸°ëŠ¥ì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.

  • forâ€¦of loop
  • spread ì—°ì‚°ì
  • êµ¬ì¡°ë¶„í•´
  • ê¸°íƒ€ iterableì„ ì¸ìˆ˜ë¡œ ë°›ëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜

ìœ„ì— ì–¸ê¸‰í•œ built-in iterableì— í•´ë‹¹ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸ì—ì„œ ì´í„°ëŸ¬ë¸”ì„ ë§Œë“œëŠ” ë°©ë²•ì€ ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ë‹¤.

Iteration Protocol

  • ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸ì— Symbol.iterator ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ ì¶”ê°€í•œë‹¤.
  • Symbol.iterator ë©”ì„œë“œëŠ” next ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ í¬í•¨í•˜ëŠ” iterator(ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸)ë¥¼ ë¦¬í„´í•œë‹¤.
  • next()ê°€ ë¦¬í„´í•˜ëŠ” ë°¸ë¥˜ëŠ” ë°˜ë“œì‹œ {done: Boolean, value: any} í˜•íƒœë¥¼ ê°–ì¶°ì•¼ í•œë‹¤. valueëŠ” í˜„ì¬ ê°’ì˜ ìƒíƒœë¥¼ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ë©°, done ì€ ë°˜ë“œì‹œ ë¶ˆë¦¬ì–¸ ê°’ì„ ì§€ë‹Œë‹¤. done=true ì¼ ê²½ìš°ëŠ” iterationì´ ëë‚¬ë‹¤ëŠ” ëœ»ì´ë‹¤.
  • forâ€¦of ë£¨í”„ê°€ ì‹œì‘ë˜ë©´, ì´ ë£¨í”„ëŠ” ìœ„ ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ í•œë²ˆ í˜¸ì¶œí•œë‹¤. ì´ì œ for..ofëŠ” ë¦¬í„´ëœ ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸ ìƒì—ì„œ ì‘ë™í•œë‹¤.
let range = {
  from: 1,
  to: 5
}

range[Symbol.iterator] = function() {
  return {
    current: this.from,
    last: this.to,
    next() {
      if (this.current <= this.last) {
        return {
          done: false,
          value: this.current++
        }
      } else {
        return {
          done: true
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

// 1) for..of
for (let num of range) {
  console.log(num);
}

// 1
// 2
// 3
// 4
// 5

// 2) spread ì—°ì‚°ì
const newRange = {...range, middle: '3'}
console.log(newRange); 
// { from: 1, to: 5, middle: '3', [Symbol(Symbol.iterator)]: [Function] }
const newArr = [...range, 10, 11];
console.log(newArr);
// [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 10, 11]

// 3) êµ¬ì¡°ë¶„í•´í• ë‹¹
const {from: beginning, to: last} = range
console.log(beginning, 'beginning'); // 1 'beginning'

// 4) ê¸°íƒ€ iterableì„ ì¸ìˆ˜ë¡œ ë°›ëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜
Array.from(range); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

ìœ„ì˜ Symbol.iterator ì†ì„±ì— ì €ì¥ë˜ì–´ ìˆëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜ëŠ” iterator ê°ì²´ë¥¼ ë°˜í™˜í•˜ê³  ìˆë‹¤. ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ iterator ê°ì²´ëŠ” íŠ¹ë³„í•œ ì¡°ê±´(iteratation protocol)ì„ ë§Œì¡±í•˜ëŠ” ê°ì²´ì´ë‹¤.

ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì˜ˆì‹œ

// menu ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸ì˜ ë©”ë‰´ ì´ë¦„ë§Œ ë°˜ë³µí•´ì„œ ëŒë¦¬ê³  ì‹¶ì„ë•Œ
const menu = {
  salads: ['Quinoa Chicken Salad', 'Santa Fe Spicy', 'Capri Paradise'],
  burger: ['Crab Heaven', 'Classic Burger', 'Spicy Chicken Burger'],
  juice: ['Orange Juice', 'Carrot & Apple Juice']
};

menu[Symbol.iterator] = function() {
  const keysArr = Object.keys(this);
  const flattened = keysArr.reduce((acc, cur) => acc.concat(this[cur]), [])
  return {
    current: 0,
    to: flattened.length,
    next() {
      if (this.current < flattened.length) {
        return {
          done: false,
          value: flattened[this.current++]
        }
      } else {
        return { done: true }
      }
    }
  }
}
// looping through menu
for (let m of menu) {
  console.log(m)
}

/*
'Quinoa Chicken Salad'
'Santa Fe Spicy'
'Capri Paradise'
'Crab Heaven'
'Classic Burger'
'Spicy Chicken Burger'
'Orange Juice'
'Carrot & Apple Juice'
*/

currentTargetì€ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ê°€ í•¸ë“¤ë§ë˜ëŠ” ë•Œì—ë§Œ ì ‘ê·¼ ê°€ëŠ¥í•˜ë‹¤. ë¹„ë™ê¸°ì½œì€ task queueì— ë“¤ì–´ê°€ ìˆë‹¤ê°€ ìŠ¤íƒì—ì„œ í˜¸ì¶œë˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— event.currentTargetì„ ìƒì–´ë²„ë¦°ë‹¤.

ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ê°€ ë°œìƒí•œ root elementë¥¼ ëª…í™•íˆ í•˜ê³  ì‹¶ì€ ê²½ìš°, ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ ëª¨ë‹¬ ì°½ì—ì„œ ëª¨ë‹¬ì´ ëœ¨ë©´ ë°±ê·¸ë¼ìš´ë“œëŠ” ì–´ë‘ì›Œì§€ê³  ê·¸ ë°±ê·¸ë¼ìš´ë“œë¥¼ ëˆŒë €ì„ë•Œ(click ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ê°€ ë°œìƒí–ˆì„ ë•Œ) ëª¨ë‹¬ ì°½ì„ ì—†ì• ê³  ì‹¶ì„ ë•Œ ì‚¬ìš©í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤. documentì—ì„œ click ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ê°€ ë°œìƒí–ˆì„ ì‹œ ëª¨ë‹¬ ì°½ì„ êº¼ì•¼ í•˜ì§€ë§Œ, ëª¨ë‹¬ ì°½ ë‚´ë¶€ë¥¼ í´ë¦­í–ˆì„ ë•ŒëŠ” ëª¨ë‹¬ ì°½ì´ êº¼ì§€ë©´ ì•ˆë˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì´ë‹¤. ì´ ê²½ìš°ëŠ” ëª¨ë‹¬ ì»´í¬ë„ŒíŠ¸ì— refë¥¼ ê±¸ê³  event.targetì´ ëª¨ë‹¬ì°½ ë‚´ë¶€ì— ìˆëŠ” ê²½ìš°ë¥¼ ë¶„ê¸°ì²˜ë¦¬í•œë‹¤.

import React, { useRef, useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import styled from 'styled-components';
import { ProductList } from '../ProductList';
import { CheerUpProductItem } from '../CheerUpProductItem';
import { useCheerUpProductList } from './useCheerUpProductList';
import { Modal } from '../Modal';

type Props = unknown;

export const CheerUpProductList: React.FC<Props> = (): JSX.Element => {
  const { data } = useCheerUpProductList();
  const ref = useRef<HTMLDivElement>(null);
  const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState<boolean>(false);
  const [imgUrl, setImgUrl] = useState<string>('');

  const handleItemClick = (url: string) => {
    setIsOpen(prev => !prev);
    setImgUrl(url);
  };

  useEffect(() => {
    const handleOverlayClick: { (e: MouseEvent): void } = (e: MouseEvent) => {
      const isMobile = window.innerWidth < 1024;
      if (isOpen) {
        if (isMobile) {
          const okayToClose = window.innerHeight - e.clientY > 280;
          if (okayToClose) setIsOpen(prev => !prev);
        } else {
          const node = ref.current; // ëª¨ë‹¬
          if (!node) return;
          if (node.contains(e.target as Node)) { // í´ë¦­ ì¼ì–´ë‚œ ì§€ì (e.target)ì´ ëª¨ë‹¬ ë‚´ë¶€ì¸ê²½ìš° ë¬´ì‹œ
            return;
          }
          setIsOpen(prev => !prev);
        }
      }
    };
    document.addEventListener('click', handleOverlayClick);
    return () => {
      document.removeEventListener('click', handleOverlayClick);
    };
  }, [isOpen]);

  return (
    <Container>
      {isOpen && <ModalOverlay />}
      <ProductList>
        {data.map(item => (
          <CheerUpProductItem key={item.id} product={item} onItemClick={handleItemClick} />
        ))}
      </ProductList>
      <Modal ref={ref} isOpen={isOpen} imgUrl={imgUrl} onModalClose={() => setIsOpen(prev => !prev)} />
    </Container>
  );
};

const Container = styled.div`
  background-color: white;
  width: 100%;
  margin: 0px auto;
  min-height: 100vh;
  position: relative;
`;

const ModalOverlay = styled.div`
  position: absolute;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
`;

event.stopPropagation()ê³¼ event.stopImmediatePropagation()ì˜ ì°¨ì´?

stopPropagation()ì„ í•˜ë©´ ìœ„ìª½ìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ ë²„ë¸”ë§ë˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ ë©ˆì¶˜ë‹¤. click ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ì— ë”°ë¥¸ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ í•¸ë“¤ëŸ¬ sayHey, sayByeê°€ ìˆë‹¤ê³  í–ˆì„ë•Œ sayHeyì—ì„œ stopPropagation()ì„ í–ˆë‹¤ë©´ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ê°€ ë²„ë¸”ë§ë˜ì§€ ì•Šì•„ ìƒìœ„ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ í•¸ë“¤ëŸ¬ëŠ” ì‹¤í–‰ë˜ì§€ ì•Šì§€ë§Œ sayHeyëŠ” ì‹¤í–‰ëœë‹¤. (í™•ì¸í•´ë³´ê¸° â‡’ https://codesandbox.io/s/long-rain-p5ml1?file=/src/index.js)

ë²„ë¸”ë§ì„ ë©ˆì¶”ê³  ìš”ì†Œì— í• ë‹¹ëœ ë‹¤ë¥¸ í•¸ë“¤ëŸ¬ì˜ ë™ì‘ë„ ë§‰ìœ¼ë ¤ë©´ event.stopImmediatePropagation()ì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ì•¼ í•œë‹¤.

<div class="container">
  <h1># stopPropagation</h1>
  <div class="parent">
    <h3>parent</h3>
    <div class="child">
      <h3>child</h3>
      <div class="grand-child">
        <h3>grand child</h3>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
function sayBye(event) {
  alert(`Bye`);
}

function sayHey(event) {
  alert('Hey');
  event.stopImmediatePropagation(); // event.stopPropagation()ê³¼ ë¹„êµí•´ë³´ê¸°
}
const child = document.querySelector('.child');
const parent = document.querySelector('.parent');
const grandChild = document.querySelector('.grand-child');
grandChild.addEventListener('click', sayHey);
grandChild.addEventListener('click', sayBye);

on<event>Â í”„ë¡œí¼í‹°ë‚˜ HTML ì†ì„±,Â addEventListener(event, handler)ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ í• ë‹¹ëœ í•¸ë“¤ëŸ¬ëŠ” ìº¡ì²˜ë§ì— ëŒ€í•´ ì „í˜€ ì•Œì§€ ëª»í•œë‹¤. ì´ í•¸ë“¤ëŸ¬ë“¤ì€ ë‘ ë²ˆì§¸ í˜¹ì€ ì„¸ ë²ˆì§¸ ë‹¨ê³„ì˜ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ íë¦„(íƒ€ê¹ƒ ë‹¨ê³„ì™€ ë²„ë¸”ë§ ë‹¨ê³„)ì—ì„œë§Œ ë™ì‘í•œë‹¤.

item.title: JavaScript Map and Set
item.description: Map is similar to . But the main difference is that allows keys of any type. â€“ creates the map. â€“ stores the value by the keyâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Map

Map is similar to Object. But the main difference is that Map allows keys of any type.

new Map() â€“ creates the map.

map.set(key, value) â€“ stores the value by the key.

map.get(key) â€“ returns the value by the key, undefined if key doesnâ€™t exist in map.

map.has(key) â€“ returns true if the key exists, false otherwise.

map.delete(key) â€“ removes the value by the key.

map.clear() â€“ removes everything from the map.

map.size â€“ returns the current element count.

let map = new Map();

map.set('1', 'str1'); // string
map.set(1, 'num1'); // numeric
map.set(true, 'boolean'); // boolean

console.log(map.get('1')); // 'str1'
console.log(map.get(1)); // 'num1'
console.log(map.get(true)); // 'boolean'

For looping over a map, there are 3 methods.

map.keys() â€“ returns an iterable for keys,

map.values() â€“ returns an iterable for values,

map.entries() â€“ returns an iterable for entries [key, value], itâ€™s used by default in for..of.

let coffeeMenu = new Map([
  ['americano', 3.5],
  ['espresso', 3],
  ['latte',    5]
]);

for (let coffee of coffeeMenu.keys()) {
  console.log(`${coffee} costs $${coffeeMenu.get(coffee)}`)
}

for (let coffee of coffeeMenu.entries()) {
  console.log(`${coffee[0]} costs $${coffeeMenu.get(coffee[0])}`)
}

// 'americano costs $3.5'
// 'espresso costs $3'
// 'latte costs $5'

Map has an built-in forEach method.

coffeeMenu.forEach((value, key, map) => {
  console.log(`key: ${key}, value: ${value}`)
})

How to turn an object into a Map?

let obj = {
  verano: 'summer',
  primavera: 'spring'
}

const seasonObj = Object.entries(obj)
// [ [ 'verano', 'summer' ], [ 'primavera', 'spring' ] ]

const season = new Map(seasonObj)

season.forEach((value, key) => {
  console.log(`${key} in english: ${value}`)
})

// 'verano in english: summer'
// 'primavera in english: spring'

then, How to turn a Map into an object?

We can use Object.fromEntries to get an object from Map.

Object.fromEntries(season.entries());
Object.fromEntries(season); // same result as above line

// { verano: 'summer', primavera: 'spring' }

let shoeBrands = Object.fromEntries([['converse', 'casual'], ['nike', 'sports'], ['addidas', 'sports']])

// { converse: 'casual', nike: 'sports', addidas: 'sports' }

Set

Setâ€™s each value occurs only once

new Set(iterable) â€“ creates the set, and if an iterable object is provided (usually an array), copies values from it into the set.

set.add(value) â€“ adds a value, returns the set itself.

set.delete(value) â€“ removes the value, returns true if value existed at the moment of the call, otherwise false.

set.has(value) â€“ returns true if the value exists in the set, otherwise false.

set.clear() â€“ removes everything from the set.

set.size â€“ is the elements count.

let furnitures = ['chair', 'table', 'sofa', 'doorknob', 'rug', 'table', 'sofatable']
furnitures.length; // 7

const furnitureSet = new Set(furnitures);
furnitureSet.size; // 6

furnitureSet.has('chair'); // true

Iteration over Set

We can use for..of or forEach

for (furniture of furnitureSet) {
  console.log('furniture:', furniture)
}

set.keys() â€“ returns an iterable object for values.

set.values() â€“ same as set.keys(), for compatibility with Map

set.entries() â€“ returns an iterable object for entries [value, value], exists for compatibility with Map.

Array.from

Also Iâ€™ll mention Array.from method which can be used very often with Map and Set structure.

It can be used when using Set, to convert array-like object to an array.

The Array.from() static method creates a new, shallow-copied Array instance from an array-like or iterable object.

console.log(Array.from('foo'));
// expected output: Array ["f", "o", "o"]

console.log(Array.from([1, 2, 3], x => x + x));
// expected output: Array [2, 4, 6]

Parameters

  1. arrayLike An array-like or iterable object to convert to an array.
  2. mapFn (Optional) Map function to call on every element of the array.
  3. thisArg (Optional) Value to use as this when executing mapFn

References

  • https://javascript.info/map-set
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/from
  • https://www.samanthaming.com/tidbits/90-object-from-entries/

item.title: Using currying to handle event handlers in React
item.description: Suppose we have parent and child component and parent has handler which gets activated when child componentâ€™s onChange event is called. Theâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Suppose we have parent and child component and parent has handler which gets activated when child componentâ€™s onChange event is called.

The Note component(parent) has to process onChange event from Checkbox component(grandchile) and another onChange event from Ingredient(child).

Parent 

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { Ingredient, Tags } from '../molecules';
// ...

export default function Note(): JSX.Element {
const [ingredientsList, setIngredientsList] = useState([
    { id: 1, isChecked: false, name: '1tsp of salt', focused: false },
    { id: 2, isChecked: true, name: '2 carrots', focused: false },
  ]);

// ...

const handleValueChange = (idx: number, e: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => 
	{
    const copiedIngredientsList = [...ingredientsList];
    copiedIngredientsList[idx].name = e.target.value;
    setIngredientsList(copiedIngredientsList);
  };

const handleCheckboxChange = (idx: number, e: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => 
{
const copiedIngredientsList = [...ingredientsList];
copiedIngredientsList[idx].isChecked = e.target.checked;
setIngredientsList(copiedIngredientsList);
}

return (
	<div>
	  <div>
	    <span>Ingredients</span>
	  </div>
	  {ingredientsList.map((ingredient, index) => (
        <Ingredient
          key={ingredient.id}
          checked={ingredient.isChecked}
          value={ingredient.name}
          onListChange={handleIngredientsList}
          onValueChange={handleValueChange}
          onCheckboxChange={handleCheckboxChange}
          idx={index}
        />
      ))}
	</div>
)

Child

// ...
interface Props {
  checked: boolean;
  onValueChange: (id: number, e: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => void;
  onCheckboxChange: (id: number, e: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => void;
  onListChange: (id: number, e: KeyboardEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => void;
  value: string;
  idx: number;
}

export default function Ingredient({
  isFocused,
  checked,
  onEnter,
  onValueChange,
	onCheckboxChange,
  value,
  id,
}: Props) {
  return (
    <div>
      <label htmlFor="ingredient">
        <Checkbox
          id={id}
          checked={checked}
          onCheckboxChange={onCheckboxChange}
          name={`checkbox_${id}`}
          color="primary"
        />
      </label>
      <input
        autoFocus={isFocused}
        id={value}
        type="text"
        value={value}
        onKeyDown={onEnter}
        onChange={(e) => onValueChange(id, e)}
      />
    </div>
  );
}

Grandchild

// ...

interface Props {
  id: number;
  checked: boolean;
  onCheckboxChange: (
    id: number,
    e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>,
  ) => void;
  name: string;
  color: 'primary' | 'secondary';
}

export default function Checkbox({
  id,
  checked,
  onCheckboxChange,
  name,
  color,
}: Props) {
  return (
    <CustomCheckbox
      checked={checked}
      onChange={(e) => onCheckboxChange(id, e)}
      name={name}
      color={color}
    />
  );
}

Like we see on parent component, two event handlers(handleValueChange, handleCheckboxChange) are called each on CustomCheckbox componentsâ€™ onChange event and on input elementsâ€™ onChange event.

But two event handlers contain very similar logic as below.

const handleValueChange = (idx: number, e: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => 
	{
    const copiedIngredientsList = [...ingredientsList];
    copiedIngredientsList[idx].name = e.target.value;
    setIngredientsList(copiedIngredientsList);
  };

const handleCheckboxChange = (idx: number, e: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => 
	{
		const copiedIngredientsList = [...ingredientsList];
		copiedIngredientsList[idx].isChecked = e.target.checked;
		setIngredientsList(copiedIngredientsList);
	}

By using currying, these two handlers logic can be reduced to one handler.

const handleValueChange =
  (type: string) => (idx: number, e: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    const copiedIngredientsList = [...ingredientsList];

    switch (type) {
      case 'text':
        copiedIngredientsList[idx].name = e.target.value;
        break;
      case 'checkbox':
        copiedIngredientsList[idx].isChecked = e.target.checked;
        break;
      default:
        break;
    }

    setIngredientsList(copiedIngredientsList);
  };

// ...

<div css={commonInputStyle}>
  <div css={commonTitleStyle}>
    <span>Ingredients</span>
  </div>
  {ingredientsList.map((ingredient, index) => (
    <Ingredient
      key={ingredient.id}
      checked={ingredient.isChecked}
      value={ingredient.name}
      onListChange={handleIngredientsList}
      onValueChange={handleValueChange('text')}
      onCheckboxChange={handleValueChange('checkbox')}
      idx={index}
    />
  ))}

Child and grandchild component stay the same as before. Although we have added one argument (â€˜textâ€™ and â€˜checkboxâ€™), the handler props passed towards children has same structure (id: number, e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => void; Currying method enables us to condense duplicated functions into a function while not interrupting childrenâ€™s handler prop arguments.

í˜„ ë””ë ‰í† ë¦¬ì—ì„œ touch new-file.sh ë¥¼ ì…ë ¥í•´ì„œ ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ íŒŒì¼ì„ í•˜ë‚˜ ìƒì„±í•œ ë’¤ì— ë‹¤ì‹œ í•œë²ˆ ls -l ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¥¼ ì…ë ¥í•˜ë©´ new-file.shì— ëŒ€í•œ ì •ë³´ë„ ì¶”ê°€ë˜ì–´ìˆëŠ” ê²ƒì„ í™•ì¸í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.

-rw-râ€”râ€”

ë§¨ ì™¼ìª½ì˜ - ê¸°í˜¸ëŠ” í•´ë‹¹ íŒŒì¼ì´ í´ë”ê°€ ì•„ë‹Œ íŒŒì¼ì„ì„ ì§€ì¹­í•œë‹¤. ë§¨ ì™¼ìª½ì˜ ê¸°í˜¸ê°€ d ë¼ë©´ ê·¸ê²ƒì´ í´ë”ì„ì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚¸ë‹¤.

rw- : Userê°€ í•´ë‹¹ íŒŒì¼ì— ëŒ€í•´ ì½ê¸°(read), ì“°ê¸°(write) ê¶Œí•œì´ ìˆìŒì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚¸ë‹¤.

r-- : staff groupì— ì†í•˜ì§€ë„ ì•Šìœ¼ë©° Userë„ ì•„ë‹Œ ê²½ìš° í•´ë‹¹ íŒŒì¼ì— ëŒ€í•´ ì½ê¸°(read) ê¶Œí•œì´ ìˆìŒì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚¸ë‹¤.

íŒŒì¼ì— ëŒ€í•œ ì ‘ê·¼ê¶Œí•œì„ ë°”ê¾¸ê¸° ìœ„í•´ì„œëŠ” chmod ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¥¼ ìˆ«ìë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ì„œ ì‹¤í–‰ì‹œì¼œì£¼ì–´ì•¼ í•œë‹¤.

1 = execute

2 = write

ìµœê·¼ì— codewarsë¥¼ í†µí•´ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ ë¬¸ì œë¥¼ ì¼ì£¼ì¼ì— í•œë‘ê°œì”© í’€ê³  ìˆë‹¤. ê·¸ ì¤‘ì— ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ reduce ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•œ ê¸°ì–µí• ë§Œí•œ ë¬¸ì œê°€ ìˆì–´ì„œ ë¸”ë¡œê·¸ì— ë”°ë¡œ ì •ë¦¬í•˜ê³ ì í•œë‹¤.

ë¬¸ì œëŠ” ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ë‹¤.

A format for expressing an ordered list of integers is to use a comma separated list of either

  • individual integers
  • or a range of integers denoted by the starting integer separated from the end integer in the range by a dash, â€™-â€˜. The range includes all integers in the interval including both endpoints. It is not considered a range unless it spans at least 3 numbers. For example â€œ12,13,15-17â€

Complete the solution so that it takes a list of integers in increasing order and returns a correctly formatted string in the range format.

Example:

solution([-6, -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 14, 15, 17, 18, 19, 20]);
// returns "-6,-3-1,3-5,7-11,14,15,17-20"

í‘¸ëŠ” ê³¼ì •

í•´ë‹¹ ë¬¸ì œëŠ” ì–´ë ˆì´ í˜•íƒœì˜ ìë£Œ êµ¬ì¡°ì— ì†í•œ ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ë“¤ì„ 3ê°œ ì´ìƒì˜ ì—°ì†ëœ ìˆ«ìì¼ ê²½ìš°ì— ì¤‘ê°„ì— '-' ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë§ì„ ì¶”ê°€í•˜ì—¬ ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë§ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•˜ê³ , ì—°ì†ëœ ìˆ«ìê°€ ì•„ë‹ ê²½ìš° ê·¸ëƒ¥ ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë§ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•˜ë©° ê°ìì˜ ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ êµ¬ë¶„ì€ , ë¡œ ì²˜ë¦¬í•´ì•¼í•œë‹¤.

ë‚˜ëŠ” ì²˜ìŒì—ëŠ” ì¸ìë¡œ ì£¼ì–´ì§„ ì–´ë ˆì´ë¥¼ í•œë°”í€´ ëŒë©´ì„œ ì—°ì†ëœ ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ë“¤ì´ ë“¤ì–´ê°„ sub ì–´ë ˆì´ì™€ ê·¸ë ‡ì§€ ì•Šì€ sub ì–´ë ˆì´ë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•´ì•¼ ê² ë‹¤ê³  ìƒê°í–ˆë‹¤. ê·¸ëŸ¬ë‹¤ê°€ êµ³ì´ .map â†’ .reduceë¥¼ ê±°ì¹  í•„ìš” ì—†ì´ í•œë²ˆì— .reduce ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ í†µí•´ì„œ ì—°ì†ëœ ì—˜ëŸ¬ë¨¼íŠ¸ë“¤ì„ ë¶™ì¸ ì–´ë ˆì´ë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•œ í›„ì— ì´ë¥¼ ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë§ í˜•íƒœë¡œ ë°”ê¿€ ìˆ˜ ìˆì§€ ì•Šì„ê¹Œ? ê³ ë¯¼ì„ í•˜ê²Œ ë˜ì—ˆê³  ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì´ ë¡œì§ì„ ì§°ë‹¤.

ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ ì–´ë ˆì´ ë©”ì„œë“œ reduceì— ê´€í•œ ì„¤ëª…ì€ ë‚´ ì§€ë‚œ í¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ì°¸ì¡°í•˜ë©´ ëœë‹¤.

const list = [-6, -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 14, 15, 17];
// ì´ listë¥¼ "-6,-3-1,3-5,7-11,14,15,17" ìœ¼ë¡œ ë¦¬í„´í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ ê³¼ì œì´ë‹¤.

let firstEl = true; // ì²˜ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ ì—°ì†ë˜ëŠ” ìˆ«ìê°€ ë“±ì¥í•˜ëŠ”ì§€ì— ëŒ€í•œ ë¶ˆë¦° ê°’
let count = 1; // ì—°ì†ë˜ëŠ” ë¹ˆë„ ìˆ˜
const moreList = list.reduce((acc, cur, idx) => {
  if (cur + 1 !== list[idx + 1]) {
    // í•´ë‹¹ ì¡°ê±´ì€ -6ì²˜ëŸ¼ ë‹¤ìŒ ì¸ë±ìŠ¤ì˜ ê°’ì´ ì—°ì†ìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ì–´ì§€ëŠ” ì§€ ì—¬ë¶€ë¥¼ íŒë‹¨í•œë‹¤.
    // ì´ ì¡°ê±´ì— í•©ë‹¹í•˜ë‹¤ë©´ í•´ë‹¹ cur ê°’ì˜ ë‹¤ìŒ ê°’ì€ cur ê°’ê³¼ ì—°ì†ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ”ë‹¤.
    if (cur - 1 === list[idx - 1] && count > 2) {
      // ì´ ì¡°ê±´ì€ 1ê³¼ ê°™ì´ 1 ë‹¤ìŒ ì¸ë±ìŠ¤ëŠ” 1ê³¼ ì—°ì†ë˜ì§€ ì•Šì§€ë§Œ 1ì´ ì—°ì†ë˜ëŠ” ìˆ«ìì˜ ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ ê°’ì„ì„ íŒë³„í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ ì‚¬ìš©ëœë‹¤.
      // 3ë²ˆ ì´ìƒ ì—°ì†ë˜ì–´ì•¼ í•¨ì„ íŒë³„í•œë‹¤.
      acc.push(`-${cur}`); // -ì„ ë¶™ì—¬ì„œ ì–´ë ˆì´ì— í‘¸ì‹œí•œë‹¤.
    } else {
      acc.push(cur); // ì—°ì†ë˜ì§€ ì•Šìœ¼ë¯€ë¡œ ê·¸ëƒ¥ í‘¸ì‹œí•œë‹¤.
    }
    firstEl = true;
    count = 1;
    // ì—°ì†ì€ ì´ì œ ëŠê²¼ìœ¼ë¯€ë¡œ firstEl, countë¥¼ ì´ˆê¸°í™”í•œë‹¤.
  } else {
    // í•´ë‹¹ ì¡°ê±´ì€ -3ê³¼ ê°™ì´ ë‹¤ìŒ ì¸ë±ìŠ¤ê°€ curì˜ ìˆ«ìì— ì—°ì†ë˜ëŠ” ê²½ìš°ì´ë‹¤.
    if (count === 1) {
      // ì²«ë²ˆì§¸ ì—°ì†ë˜ëŠ” ìˆ«ìê°€ ë“±ì¥í•œ ê²½ìš°
      acc.push(cur);
      count++;
      firstEl = false;
    } else {
      count++;
    }
  }
  return acc;
}, []); // ì´ˆê¹ƒê°’ì´ ì£¼ì–´ì§€ë©´ ì¸ë±ìŠ¤ëŠ” 0ë¶€í„° ì‹œì‘í•¨

console.log('moreList:', moreList);
// 'moreList:' [-6, -3, '-1', 3, '-5', 7, '-11', 14, 15, 17];

[-6, -3, '-1', 3, '-5', 7, '-11', 14, 15, 17] ì´ëŸ° í˜•íƒœì˜ ì–´ë ˆì´ê°€ ë‚˜ì™”ë‹¤. ì´ì œ ë°”ë¼ëŠ” ê°’ì— ì¢€ ë” ê°€ê¹Œì›Œì¡Œë‹¤. ì´ ì–´ë ˆì´ì—ì„œ ì—°ì†ë˜ëŠ” ê°’ì˜ ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ ê°’ì€ string í˜•íƒœì´ë¯€ë¡œ ì´ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ì„œ ë¡œì§ì„ ì§œë©´ ë  ê²ƒ ê°™ë‹¤.

let str = moreList[0]; // str ì´ˆê¹ƒê°’ ì§€ì •
moreList.forEach((el, idx) => {
  const nextIdx = idx + 1;
  if (moreList.indexOf(moreList[nextIdx]) !== -1) {
    if (typeof moreList[nextIdx] === 'string') {
      str += moreList[nextIdx];
    } else {
      str += `,${moreList[nextIdx]}`;
    }
  }
});

console.log(str); // '-6,-3-1,3-5,7-11,14,15,17'

ìœ„ì˜ ë‘ ë‹¨ê³„ ì†”ë£¨ì…˜ì„ ì´ì–´ë¶™ì—¬ì„œ ì†”ë£¨ì…˜ ë„ì¶œì— ì„±ê³µí–ˆë‹¤.

function solution(list) {
  let firstEl = true;
  let count = 1;
  const moreList = list.reduce((acc, cur, idx) => {
    if (cur + 1 !== list[idx + 1]) {
      if (cur - 1 === list[idx - 1] && count > 2) {
        acc.push(`-${cur}`); // ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ì„
      } else {
        acc.push(cur);
      }
      firstEl = true;
      count = 1;
    } else {
      if (count === 1) {
        acc.push(cur);
        count++;
        firstEl = false;
      } else {
        count++;
      }
    }
    return acc;
  }, []);

  let str = moreList[0];
  moreList.forEach((el, idx) => {
    const nextIdx = idx + 1;
    if (moreList.indexOf(moreList[nextIdx]) !== -1) {
      if (typeof moreList[nextIdx] === 'string') {
        str += moreList[nextIdx];
      } else {
        str += `,${moreList[nextIdx]}`;
      }
    }
  });
  return str;
}

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Parcel Sandbox</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <style>
      picture {
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        width: 100px;
        text-align: center;
        margin-bottom: 30px;
      }
      img {
        border-radius: 50%;
        width: 100px;
        height: auto;
        box-shadow: 0 0 15px #999;
        margin-bottom: 15px;
      }

      img.disabled {
        opacity: 0.3;
      }
    </style>
  </head>

  <body>
    <h1>Employees of this month</h1>
    <div id="app"></div>
    <script>
      var $app = document.getElementById("app");

      const Avatar = (params) => {
        const src = `https://randomuser.me/api/portraits/men/${params.id}.jpg`;
        return `<picture><img src="${src}" /></picture>`;
      };
      const avatarArr = [
        { id: 75, name: "Gale" },
        { id: 76, name: "Vincent" },
      ];
      avatarArr.forEach((avatar) => ($app.innerHTML += Avatar(avatar)));

      $app.querySelectorAll("img").forEach((img) => {
        img.addEventListener("click", () => {
          img.classList.toggle("disabled");
        });
      });
    </script>
  </body>
</html>

ìœ„ ì½”ë“œëŠ” ëœë¤ ìœ ì €ë“¤ì˜ ì‚¬ì§„ì„ ë‚˜ì—´í•˜ëŠ” ë‹¨ìˆœí•œ ì›¹ í˜ì´ì§€ì´ë‹¤. codesandbox

JSX ì—†ëŠ” ë¦¬ì•¡íŠ¸ë¡œ ì‘ì„±í•˜ë©´ ì•„ë˜ ì½”ë“œì™€ ê°™ë‹¤. codesandbox

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Parcel Sandbox</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <style>
      picture {
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        width: 100px;
        text-align: center;
        margin-bottom: 30px;
      }
      img {
        border-radius: 50%;
        width: 100px;
        height: auto;
        box-shadow: 0 0 15px #999;
        margin-bottom: 15px;
      }

      img.disabled {
        opacity: 0.3;
      }
    </style>
    <script
      crossorigin
      src="https://unpkg.com/react@17/umd/react.production.min.js"
    ></script>
    <script
      crossorigin
      src="https://unpkg.com/react-dom@17/umd/react-dom.production.min.js"
    ></script>
  </head>

  <body>
    <h1>Employees of this month</h1>
    <div id="app"></div>

    <script>
      var $app = document.getElementById("app");
      const h = React.createElement;
      const handleClick = (e) => {
        e.target.classList.toggle("disabled");
      };
      const Avatar = (params) => {
        const src = `https://randomuser.me/api/portraits/men/${params.id}.jpg`;
        return h(
          "picture",
          null,
          h("img", { src, id: params.id, onClick: handleClick })
        );
      };
      ReactDOM.render(
        h("div", null, [h(Avatar, { id: 75 }), h(Avatar, { id: 76 })]),
        $app
      );
    </script>
  </body>
</html>

const array1 = [1, 2, 3, 4];
const reducer = (accumulator, currentValue) => accumulator + currentValue;

const numArray = [1, 2, [3, 10, [11, 12]], [1, 2, [3, 4]], 5, 6];

function flattenArr(data) {

];

function modifier(arr) {

function _filter(users, predi) {

  }

const _each = (list, each) => {
  for (let i = 0; i < list.length; i++ ) {
    each(list[i])

}

const _filter = (elements, predi) => {
  const arr = [];

  })

}

const _map = (elements, mapper) => {
  const arr = [];

    arr.push(mapper(el));

}

function createThunkMiddleware(extraArgument) {
  return ({ dispatch, getState }) => next => action => {
    if (typeof action === "function") {
      // í•¨ìˆ˜ì´ë©´ ì‹¤í–‰
      return action(dispatch, getState, extraArgument);
    }

    return next(action); // ì•„ë‹Œ ê²½ìš° ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì²˜ë¦¬
  };
}

const thunk = createThunkMiddleware();

Creation Phase(ìƒì„± êµ­ë©´)

ì‹¤í–‰ ì»¨í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ì˜ ë‚´ë¶€ì—ì„œëŠ” ì½”ë“œì—ì„œ ì‚¬ìš©ë˜ëŠ” ë³€ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ì €ì¥í•˜ê³  ê´€ë¦¬í•œë‹¤. ì´ ë•Œ ì‹¤í–‰ ì»¨í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ì—ì„œ ë³€ìˆ˜ ë° í•¨ìˆ˜ ì„ ì–¸ì„ ì €ì¥í•˜ëŠ” ê°ì²´ë¥¼ í™œì„± ê°ì²´(Activation Object) ë˜ëŠ” ë³€ìˆ˜ ê°ì²´(Variable Object)ë¼ê³  ë¶€ë¥¸ë‹¤.

Hoistingê°œë…ì„ ì„¤ëª…í•˜ê¸° ì „ì— ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ì—ì„œ í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ë§Œë“œëŠ” ë‹¤ë¥¸ ë°©ì‹ì¸ í•¨ìˆ˜ ì„ ì–¸ë¬¸(Function Declarations)ê³¼ í•¨ìˆ˜ í‘œí˜„ì‹(Function Expressions)ì— ëŒ€í•´ ê°„ë‹¨íˆ ì§šê³  ë„˜ì–´ê°€ì.

//í•¨ìˆ˜ í‘œí˜„ì‹ : ë³€ìˆ˜ê°’ì— í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ë‹´ì•„ë†“ì€ í˜•íƒœ

(ì¦‰, ëª¨ë“  í•¨ìˆ˜ëŠ” ì‹¤í–‰ ë¬¸ë§¥ ì•ˆì— ì €ì¥ëœë‹¤. í•¨ìˆ˜ê°€ ì‹¤í–‰ë„ ë˜ê¸° ì „ì— ë§ì´ë‹¤.) ì´ í”„ë¡œí¼í‹°ëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ê°€ë¦¬í‚¨ë‹¤.
  • ë³€ìˆ˜ ì„ ì–¸ë¬¸(variable declarations)ì´ ì‘ì„±ë  ë•Œ ì½”ë“œê°€ ìŠ¤ìº”ëœë‹¤. ë³€ìˆ˜ ê°ì²´ ë‚´ì— í”„ë¡œí¼í‹°ê°€ ìƒì„±ë˜ë©° ê·¸ ê°’ì€ undefinedë¡œ ê·œì •ëœë‹¤.

ì´ ë‘ ê°€ì§€ ê²½ìš°ë¥¼ hoistingì´ë¼ê³  ë¶€ë¥¸ë‹¤. ì¦‰, í•¨ìˆ˜/ë³€ìˆ˜ê°€ ì„ ì–¸ë  ë•Œ ì½”ë“œê°€ ìŠ¤ìº”ë˜ê³  ë³€ìˆ˜ ê°ì²´ ë‚´ì— í”„ë¡œí¼í‹°ê°€ ìƒì„±ëœë‹¤. ê·¸ëŸ¬ë‚˜ í•¨ìˆ˜ì™€ ë³€ìˆ˜ì˜ í˜¸ì´ìŠ¤íŒ…ì—ëŠ” ì°¨ì´ê°€ ì¡´ì¬í•œë‹¤. í•¨ìˆ˜ì˜ ê²½ìš°, ì‹¤í–‰ êµ­ë©´ì´ ì±„ ì‹œì‘ë˜ê¸° ì „ì— ì´ë¯¸ ì •ì˜ëœ ìƒíƒœì´ë‹¤. í•˜ì§€ë§Œ ë³€ìˆ˜ëŠ” undefinedëœ ìƒíƒœì´ë©°, ì‹¤í–‰ êµ­ë©´ì— ë“¤ì–´ê°€ë©´ ê·¸ ë•Œ ì •ì˜ë  ê²ƒì´ë‹¤.

HOISTING

Hoisting, í•œêµ­ë§ë¡œëŠ” â€˜ëŒì–´ì˜¬ë¦¬ê¸°â€™ ë¼ëŠ” ëœ» ì¦˜ìœ¼ë¡œ í•´ì„ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤. í•¨ìˆ˜ ì„ ì–¸ê³¼ í•¨ê»˜ ì½”ë“œê°€ ìŠ¤ìº”ë˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— í•¨ìˆ˜ë‚˜ ë³€ìˆ˜ê°€ ë°‘ì— ìœ„ì¹˜í•˜ì—¬ë„ ì½”ë“œ ìƒ ìœ„ì— ìœ„ì¹˜í•´ìˆëŠ” í˜¸ì¶œêµ¬ë¬¸ì—ì„œ í˜¸ì¶œì´ ê°€ëŠ¥í•˜ë‹¤.

calcAgeëŠ” í˜¸ì´ìŠ¤íŒ…ì´ ë˜ì—ˆì§€ë§Œ, retirementëŠ” í˜¸ì´ìŠ¤íŒ…ì´ ë˜ì§€ ì•Šì•˜ë‹¤. í˜¸ì´ìŠ¤íŒ…ì€ í•¨ìˆ˜ ì„ ì–¸ë¬¸ì—ë§Œ ìœ íš¨í•˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì´ë‹¤. retirementëŠ” anonymous functionì„ retirementë¼ëŠ” ë³€ìˆ˜ì— ë‹´ì•„ ì‹¤í–‰í•œ í•¨ìˆ˜ì´ë‹¤. ì´ ê²½ìš°ëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜ ì„ ì–¸ë¬¸(Function Declarations)ì´ ì•„ë‹Œ í•¨ìˆ˜ í‘œí˜„ì‹(Function Expressions)ì— í•´ë‹¹í•œë‹¤.

ë³€ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ì„ ì–¸í•˜ë¯€ë¡œ í˜¸ì´ìŠ¤íŒ…ì´ ë˜ì§€ë§Œ, ê°’ì€ undefinedì´ë¯€ë¡œ undefinedê°€ ì¶œë ¥ëœë‹¤.

B. ìŠ¤ì½”í”„ ì²´ì¸ì˜ í˜•ì„±

ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ì—ì„œ ìŠ¤ì½”í”„ëŠ” ì „ì—­ ìŠ¤ì½”í”„, ë¡œì»¬ ìŠ¤ì½”í”„ë¡œ ë‚˜ë‰œë‹¤. ë¡œì»¬ ìŠ¤í¬í¬ëŠ” ì •ì˜ëœ í•¨ìˆ˜ ë‚´ì˜ ì˜ì—­ì„ ì¼ì»«ëŠ”ë‹¤. ìŠ¤ì½”í”„ ì²´ì¸ì˜ ìˆœì„œëŠ” ì‹¤í–‰ ì»¨í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ì™€ ë°˜ëŒ€ë¡œ ê°€ì¥ ê¹Šì€ ê³³ì˜ ìŠ¤ì½”í”„ë¶€í„° ê¸€ë¡œë²Œ ìŠ¤ì½”í”„ë¡œ íë¥¸ë‹¤. (ìì„¸í•œ ì„¤ëª…ì€ ì§€ë‚œ ë²ˆ í¬ìŠ¤íŒ…ì— ì¼ìœ¼ë¯€ë¡œ ìƒëµ)

var a = "one!";
first();
function first() {
  var b = "two!";
  second();

  function second() {
    var c = "three!";

C. this í‚¤ì›Œë“œ

thisëŠ” ëª¨ë“  ì‹¤í–‰ ì»¨í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ê°€ ê°–ê³  ìˆëŠ” ë³€ìˆ˜ì´ë‹¤. ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ì‹¤í–‰ì»¨í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸ì— ì €ì¥ëœë‹¤. thisë¥¼ í˜¸ì¶œí•  ë•Œ, thisëŠ” ìì‹ ì˜ ì†í•œ ê³³ì˜ ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸ë¥¼ ê°€ë¦¬í‚¨ë‹¤. thisê°€ ê²°ì •ë˜ëŠ” ì›ë¦¬ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ë‹¤.

  • ì¼ë°˜ì ì¸ í•¨ìˆ˜ í˜¸ì¶œ(Regular function call): thisí‚¤ì›Œë“œëŠ” ê¸€ë¡œë²Œ ì˜¤ë¸Œì íŠ¸ë¥¼ ê°€ë¦¬í‚¨ë‹¤.

  • ë©”ì†Œë“œ í˜¸ì¶œ(Method call): thisëŠ” ë©”ì†Œë“œë¥¼ í˜¸ì¶œí•˜ëŠ” ê°ì²´ë¥¼ ê°€ë¦¬í‚¨ë‹¤. (ë©”ì†Œë“œëŠ” ê°ì²´ì— ì†í•´ìˆëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜ì´ë‹¤.)

import React, { useState } from 'react'

isOpenê°’ì´ trueì¼ë•ŒëŠ” showNav í´ë˜ìŠ¤ê°€ ì ìš©ë˜ì–´ ë„¤ë¹„ê²Œì´ì…˜ ë°”ê°€ í™”ë©´ì— ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚œë‹¤.

ì‚¬ìš©ìê°€ ê°’ì„ ì…ë ¥í•  ë•Œë§ˆë‹¤ this.stateê°’ì„ ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸í•´ì£¼ë©° ì²«ë²ˆì§¸ ë¹„ë°€ë²ˆí˜¸ë¥¼ ë„£ëŠ” í•„ë“œì™€ ë‘ë²ˆì§¸ ë¹„ë°€ë²ˆí˜¸ë¥¼ ë„£ëŠ” í•„ë“œë¥¼ ë¹„êµí•´ì„œ, ê°’ì´ ë‹¤ë¥¸ ê²½ìš° â€œë¹„ë°€ë²ˆí˜¸ê°€ ì¼ì¹˜í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.â€, ê°’ì´ ê°™ì€ ê²½ìš° â€œë¹„ë°€ë²ˆí˜¸ê°€ ì¼ì¹˜í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.â€ ë¼ëŠ” ë©”ì‹œì§€ë¥¼ í™”ë©´ì— ë³´ ì—¬ì£¼ê³  ì‹¶ë‹¤.

class PwVerify extends React.Component {
  constructor() {

      password: '',

    };  // ì´ˆê¸° stateê°’ì„ ì…‹íŒ…í•´ì¤€ë‹¤. ë¹ˆ ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë§ ê°’ì€ falseë¥¼ ëœ»í•œë‹¤.
  }

handleConfirmPassword = (e) => {

    if (e.target.value !== this.state.rePassword) {

    }

      }) // ì‚¬ìš©ìê°€ ì…ë ¥í•œ ë¹„ë°€ë²ˆí˜¸ê°€ ë‘ê°œ ë‹¤ ì¼ì¹˜í•˜ë©´ ë³´ì—¬ì£¼ëŠ” ë©”ì‹œì§€.

        }

handleConfirmrePassword = (e) => {

}

render() {

class Picker extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);
    this.state ={
      startDate: null,
      endDate: null,
      focusedInpupt: null,
      date: null,
      focused: true
    }
  }
  handleDateChange = (dates) => {
    let startDate = dates.startDate;
    let endDate = dates.endDate;
    this.props.saveTripDate(startDate, endDate); //propsë¥¼ í†µí•´ ì „ë‹¬ë°›ì€ ë¶€ëª¨ ë©”ì„œë“œ
    this.setState({

  }

  render() {
    return (
      <div>
        <div>
